intro: Cyclobalanopsis longinux, commonly known as the long-leaf chinquapin, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks, beeches, and chestnuts. The plant is characterized by its elongated, leathery leaves and produces small, edible nuts enclosed in a spiny husk. It typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments and can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Cyclobalanopsis longinux plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
